wrath.util

Class Encryption

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrath.util.Encryption

  • public class Encryption
extends java.lang.Object
    Library to Encrypt and Decrypt byte data. Uses AES Encryption Algorithm.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String ALGORITHM 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static byte[] decryptData(byte[] encryptedData, javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec key)
      Decrypts specified data using specified algorithm and key.
      static byte[] encryptData(byte[] originalData, javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec key)
      Encrypts specified data using specified algorithm and key.
      static javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec generateKey(byte[] key)
      Generates a key with no salt.
      static javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec generateKey(byte[] key, byte[] salt)
      Generates a secure, salted hash for a security key.
      static javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec generateKey(java.lang.String key)
      Generates a key with a salt found in the passphrase itself.
      static javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec generateKey(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String salt)
      Generates a secure, salted hash for a security key.

        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • decryptData

        public static byte[] decryptData(byte[] encryptedData,
                                 javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec key)
        Decrypts specified data using specified algorithm and key.
        Parameters:
        encryptedData - The encrypted data to decrypt.
        key - The security key to decrypt the data.
        Returns:
        Returns the decrypted data according to specifications. If decryption failed, returns original encrypted data.
        See Also:
        generateKey(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

      • encryptData

        public static byte[] encryptData(byte[] originalData,
                                 javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec key)
        Encrypts specified data using specified algorithm and key.
        Parameters:
        originalData - The data to encrypt.
        key - The security key to encrypt the data.
        Returns:
        Returns the encrypted data according to specifications. If encryption failed, returns original data.
        See Also:
        generateKey(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

      • generateKey

        public static javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec generateKey(java.lang.String key)
        Generates a key with a salt found in the passphrase itself. Not as secure as using a unique salt but more secure than no salt.
        Parameters:
        key - The key, or passphrase, to generate the security key with.
        Returns:
        Returns the Key object for cyptography.

      • generateKey

        public static javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec generateKey(java.lang.String key,
                                                          java.lang.String salt)
        Generates a secure, salted hash for a security key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key, or passphrase, to generate the security key with.
        salt - The salt to generate this key's hash with.
        Returns:
        Returns the Key object for cyptography.

      • generateKey

        public static javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec generateKey(byte[] key,
                                                          byte[] salt)
        Generates a secure, salted hash for a security key.
        Parameters:
        key - The raw key to generate the security key with.
        salt - The salt to generate this key's hash with.
        Returns:
        Returns the Key object for cyptography.

      • generateKey

        public static javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec generateKey(byte[] key)
        Generates a key with no salt. This is NOT recommended!
        Parameters:
        key - The raw key to generate the security key with.
        Returns:
        Returns the SecretKeySpec object for cyptography.
